author: Odeinoichus
title: Speeding Towards Championship.
review:
Set #30342 Lamborghini Huracan Super Trofeo EVO: LEGO introduced Speed Champions in 2015 and for five years we did not see any Polybags from this Theme. Now, in 2020 the LEGO Speed Champions Theme has received its very own Microscale build and it is quite brilliant. In point of fact it’s really impressive. Let us discuss the pros and cons of the set.

Pros:

  • Very well put together model, fun to build, creative, captures the likeness very well.
  • Excellent piece-per-price ratio.
  • Great use of parts.

Cons:

  • No printed elements, includes sticker for detailing.
  • Not easily accessible at retail at this time.

Overall opinion

I’m very impressed with this model and it has inspired me to perhaps work harder at getting one of the Minifigure scale sets. I don’t know cars, I am not an automotive expert, but I do enjoy LEGO vehicles. Many Creator Polybags have built excellent real-world vehicles at micro scale for fun builds and fun toys in general. Speed Champions takes a licensed vehicle and turns it into an excellent toy. Perfect for birthdays, good report cards or holidays. Highly Recommended.

author: digi_raptor
title: A mediocre gift with purchase
review:
This is a mediocre gift with purchase, I personally wouldn't buy this if it wasn't a free gift. The build looks alright for it's size but has stickers for detailing instead of prints. I would have preferred printed pieces as this is a polybag, but I understand that most if not all Speed Champions sets use stickers as there would be a lot of detail to print, but this is a very small polybag and should at least include 1 print. The tyres on this car are pretty smooth and roll well so is good for play. I like the inclusion of the new metallic gold plates (included in some of the new Monkie Kid sets) as it makes the build look so much better.

Overall, I think this is an okay poly bag, not bad, but not the best.
